author: Alan Shields
comment: I tried the free version. I paid for the no adds upgrade. Now with the latest updates I have adds again unless I pay a monthly fee. I am very disappointed.

reply.author: DepollSoft
reply.content: If you kept the ad remover installed, you should still be ad free. Did you uninstall it?

author: Nathaniel Ackom
comment: Great app

author: Russian Bot
comment: I've had no issues with it. For those of you who purchased a license, you can still find and download it from your Play Store purchase history. Once you do, the ads are gone, same as ever, so the developer isn't ripping you off. He's changed business model, but he's not ripping off his earliest customers.

author: G Jasmin
comment: The sound this app produces make it intolerable to use, a far cry from the sine wave that was expected, please listen to your consumers and address this issue:)  Update: I downloaded this app to see if anything had changed the swiftly uninstalled in disappointment. Seriously, the sound makes what other wise would be a great app entirely unusable. It didn't used to be this way, please revert the sound back to the way it was, or at least offer the option to change the sound settings back to the advertised sine sound wave, or at the very least respond to let us know that your hearing us out; this is discouraging...

reply.author: DepollSoft
reply.content: The code for the audio produced hasn't changed in years. A pure sine wave is unfortunately too quiet to be usable in most settings, even with the volume turned all the way up. What you're hearing is a sine wave, amplified and then clipped. You're right it doesn't produce the prettiest sound, but it's a compromise to make the app usable.

author: Mark Johnston
comment: Not pretty, but feature-rich and does the job

author: Antwione Barnes
comment: Its a great vocal app for pitch range and to find out if your singing flat or to sharp of a notes. Also to help u memorize notes from head voice and chest voice if your not near music, or proper floor monitor when do a show...

author: A Google User
comment: This app 'was' the best I had found for those who strictly want to replace their pitch pipe.  Changing from 5 stars to 1 after my paid license was tossed in the trash by the developer and a monthly fee scheme was pushed out instead. First I tried emailing the address listed and when that that was returned undeliverable I decided to update my review.   FROM EMAIL : Hi,  I can find no way to get rid of the obnoxious ads that have appeared, other than subscribing - despite the fact I already purchased a license.   Please either let me know how to do so, forward me the old API for use with my license, or refund my purchase.   Thanks for your help  FROM ORIGINAL 5 STAR REVIEW : The only thing that 'was' missing, in my opinion, was the ability to create and save multiple, custom song lists, or "programs".  DEVELOPER: Please consider if it would be possible to add functionality to the song list:  multiple lists that can be named and saved in a "library", ability to add text line items to the song list (ones that don't require a key/pitch assignment)  Thanks

author: Tom Holden
comment: Very disappointed in the audio quality on my Moto g4 Play. It's great on my iPad 2. Otherwise, similar functionality.  Can't imagine how the tones are generated. Doesn't even sound like a digitally sampled sine wave in the absence of the Nyquist filter.

author: Jason Dearing
comment: Fantastic pitch application, and the song list works great. Would be 5 stars if I could import a song list with keys, rather than typing 20+ songs in by hand. Can this be added? I'd pay for the option in-app. Thanks for a great app!

author: Rio Wong
comment: Well, thanks for the fixes. But the widget texts are still very small abnormally though it's been enlarged very very slightly

reply.author: DepollSoft
reply.content: I'll have to look into this further.  There's a platform quirk that causes the text to be majorly oversized on some devices and on Nougat.  The text size has been doubled in the meantime (which fits on both devices), but I'm looking for a way to work around this so that it works correctly everywhere.  Sorry, and thank you for your patience.

author: Eugene Capeder
comment: Have speech impediment - valuable tool in my recovery process.
title: Very Helpful Application

author: A Google User
comment: If you need to give pitches for a set, this app is a MUST!!!  It lists the song and the key.  All you do is press the song, and the starting pitch is played!  It works also with your smart watch!  I highly recommend supporting a developer who gives you exactly what a performer needs on stage!   BRAVO!!!
title: This App is Perfect for A Cappella

author: Andrew Robertson
comment: The only issue I have is: Instead of going to Higher Pitched Notes by moving Up the Screen, you need to go Down!? Isn't this really backwards?

author: Aby V Koshy
comment: Helps you take the correct pitch. Nothing fancy, very useful.

author: thymmai syiem
comment: Needs update. Sometimes two notes produce the same tone.

comment: WHAT IS THIS.

comment: Great app for new barbershop singer like me!
We'll will see havn't inplimeded yet

comment: Wastes

author: Caroline Cuff
comment: This app was amazing for finding the pitch. But since it's last update, the sound it produces is deplorable. The notes sound as if they are being slaughtered by machinery. That is the only way I can describe it. Please change it back to the way it was in 2015 please.
title: Used to be awesome...

author: Kael Shipman
comment: Everything I want, right on my home screen. Also great for a drone tone to play around with when you're bored.
title: Wonderful pitch widget!

author: Scott Casey
comment: Screen /wallpaper is too busy for my tastes.  I like buying the apps that I use,  but I'm not doing a subscription!

author: Frode Svendsen
comment: Disappointing that I have to use Facebook login to store/backup the song list.
title: Awesome app, especially the song list, but..

author: Grace Warren
comment: It sounds to much like a machine not a real pitch pipe
title: Blah

author: Darius Sanders
comment: Sometimes I press a pitch square and it gives me a half step up or down, or it doesn't give me the pitch at all.
title: Fix the widget!

author: Marc Lee
comment: makes playing music on phone easier. put 12 keys per row. higher row means higher pitch. allows customization on whether certain row is showing
title: can redisgn the layout of keys,

comment: See no Lockscreen on off thingie, A is at 440Hz...Where is 442 Hz?

author: Nathan Szpakowski
comment: Very simple and user friendly, only issue I found is the widget doesn't work properly because where you touch isn't what gets activated. You could touch a C# and the D would play and this is true for almost every note

reply.author: DepollSoft
reply.content: I think I may finally have a fix for this (it's an issue caused by some weirdness in Lollipop) -- see the next release.

title: Great app

author: joseph muema
comment: Thanks for the pitch pipe. It's wonderful and easy to give choir the right key.

comment: Not even good

comment: Great App

comment: Very useful

comment: Useful

author: Tucker Prestridge
comment: What happened to the widget? It stopped playing the right notes and started playing the notes across the widget from the selected pitch, but only for half the pitches. Please fix! The widget is one of the best parts about this app. Will revert back to 5 starts once it's fixed! :)

reply.author: DepollSoft
reply.content: This appears to be a bug in Lollipop -- I'll look into it further.
